intro: Aylostera cajasensis, commonly known as the Cajas aylostera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Aylostera cajasensis is typically found in humid, montane forests at elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters.
